alert.note: Alert for Iron; Reynolds (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 06 at 3:14AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Missouri, including the following counties, Iron and Reynolds. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 312 AM CDT, multiple rounds of heavy rainfall had fallen, leading to rainfall totals of 2 to 4 inches in spots. Although the rain has decreased in intensity, runoff from earlier rainfall will continue to cause minor flooding across the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ironton, Reynolds, Pilot Knob, Arcadia, Annapolis, Glover, Centerville, Lesterville, Redford, Black, Sabula, Chloride, Hogan and Corridon.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
